alert.note: Alert for Alfalfa; Garfield; Grant; Kay; Noble (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 6:12AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Kay, northwestern Noble, northeastern Alfalfa, Grant and eastern Garfield Counties through 645 AM CDT... At 609 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hunter, moving southeast at 25 mph. Other thunderstorms were located over northern Alfalfa county near Amorita. Storms were also developing across northern sections of Noble and northern Garfield. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Enid, Medford, Pond Creek, Garber, Covington, Billings, Lamont, Wakita, Kremlin, Breckenridge, Nash, Hunter, Fairmont, Deer Creek, Manchester, Amorita, Byron, Jefferson, Lucien and northeastern Great Salt Plains Lake. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 189 and 213. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
